item.description:
If you appreciate local artists, I think you'll like this exhibit. I curated it so I'm a little biased, but it got great reviews from the many people that have viewed it since it opened on Jan. 23. The opening reception attracted over 150 people of all ages and interests. Come to this Saturday viewing when the museum won't be so crowded and maybe even purchase one of the artworks. It is large variety of art styles, something for everyone. Hope you can make it.

Brighton-Allston Heritage Museum

20 Chestnut Hill Avenue
Brighton, Massachusetts 02135 USA

"SEEING AND SENSING ART:
Allston, Brighton and Beyond"

Brighton-Allston Heritage Museum
Winship Gallery
January 23, 2010 - March 13, 2010

Museum Hours - Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday and Friday and 2nd/4th Saturday of the month - Noon to 4:00 PM




An art survey exhibition of over 70 two-dimensional paintings and photographs from 20 artists that focus on the splendor and majesty and diversity of contemporary and historical artwork over the past 150 years. These art works were all selected to demonstrate the grandeur of Allston-Brighton artists and subjects from Allston-Brighton. The selected pieces demonstrate the power of art to invoke comfort, popular imagery, happiness, love, symbolism and nostalgia, The art includes contemporary, historical, abstract and expressionism styles of art as put forth through portraits, still lives and landscapes. The artists all use skillful lines, colors and context through the use of oil, watercolor, graphite, pastel, acrylic and ink and well as photography to help us see and sense their artwork. Some of the art on exhibit will also be for sale by the artists.

The museum is also exhibiting "Brighton Transformed" in the Main Gallery, which has been enhanced and upgraded to coincide with the opening of the "Seeing and Feeling the Paintings" Exhibition.
